In these troubling times it's important to have something to believe in. Normally, this is where I'd say "I believe I'll have another beer." But instead I'll point you in the direction of urlLink Belief-O-Matic , which will tell you its opinion of the religion that most closely matches your beliefs based on your answers to some pretty heavy questions. Interestingly, I turn out to be more Jehovah' Witness than Orthodox Jew. I'm neither, so I guess that's ok. I'm just shocked that UU beat out SH by 1%. Good thing I got married at a UU church, eh? Here's my breakdown... 1. Unitarian Universalism (100%) 2. Secular Humanism (99%) 3. Liberal Quakers (91%) 4. Neo-Pagan (83%) 5. Mainline to Liberal Christian Protestants (81%) 6. Theravada Buddhism (76%) 7. Nontheist (66%) 8. New Age (65%) 9. Mahayana Buddhism (62%) 10. Taoism (56%) 11. Reform Judaism (56%) 12. Orthodox Quaker (54%) 13. Sikhism (54%) 14. Jainism (51%) 15. Bahá'í Faith (50%) 16. Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints (Mormons) (47%) 17. Hinduism (41%) 18. Christian Science (Church of Christ, Scientist) (37%) 19. New Thought (35%) 20. Scientology (35%) 21. Mainline to Conservative Christian/Protestant (34%) 22. Jehovah's Witness (31%) 23. Seventh Day Adventist (31%) 24. Orthodox Judaism (27%) 25. Eastern Orthodox (25%) 26. Islam (25%) 27. Roman Catholic (25%) Original link courtesy of Comrade Adam at urlLink Ennui Central

note to middle managers: go curl up and die. then go to hell. where you can be force fed flaming status reports and gouged in the ears with red hot "what you're hearing is your soul screaming" pokers. hey, it's just a thought.

It's not the most original phrase in the world (damn you, Zeldman) but it is true today: I am a happy cog. There is nothing about my job that will break my serenity. It is the serenity of the utterly doomed. And, since I have accepted this doom, I can go quietly and without anger through the rest of my day here. Repeat after me: I am a happy cog.
a deucedly clever first post, if I do say so myself.

"A few months ago I told the American people I did not trade arms for hostages. My heart and my best intentions still tell me that's true, but the facts and the evidence tell me it is not." An except from belovéd and now deceased former president Ronald Wilson Reagan's address to the nation concerning Iran-Contra on March 4th, 1987. The whole thing can be found urlLink here.

It appears to have been an eventful weekend. I will refrain from comment on nearly all of it. Because even though certain newly deceased ex-presidents were no heroes in my home, I was raised not to speak ill of the dead. So rest in peace and all that.

urlLink The Labor Department says there are new jobs! But they don't mention whether we're talking ditch-digging and prostitution or real jobs, like selling apples on the corner. Oh well, as long as we're all employed somehow I guess we have to vote for the incumbent, right? Right?
